com.topcoder.message.email
Class TCSEmailMessage

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.message.TCSMessage
      com.topcoder.message.email.TCSEmailMessage
public class TCSEmailMessage
extends com.topcoder.message.TCSMessage

The TCSEmailMessage class represents a single email message.

Version 3.0 of TCSEmailMessage have added support for priority of the email message.

In version 3.1, this class is updated to include the content type property and an explicit default constructor is added. Other methods aren't changed, even where they don't meet current TC standards.

Version:
3.1
Author:
sord, veredox, BEHiker57W, smell, TCSDEVELOPER

addAttachment

public void addAttachment(java.io.InputStream attachment,
                          java.lang.String name)

Adds an attachment to the attachments Map variable using the InputStream of the file to be attached as the key and the name of the file as the value.

Parameters:
attachment - an InputStream containing file to be attached
name - the name of the file to attached

addToAddress

public void addToAddress(java.lang.String addr,
                         int type)
                  throws AddressException

Adds an additional "to" address of the specified type (TO, CC, BCC).

Parameters:
addr - the new "to" address
type - the new "to" address type (TO, CC, or BCC)
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if addr is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not TO, CC, nor BCC
AddressException - if addr is not a valid address according to RFC822

addToAddress

public void addToAddress(java.lang.String addr,
                         java.lang.String personal,
                         int type)
                  throws AddressException

Adds an additional to address for the specified type (TO, CC, BCC).

Parameters:
addr - the new "to" address
personal - the new personal name
type - the new "to" address type TO, CC, or BCC)
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if either addr or personal is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not TO, CC, nor BCC
AddressException - if 1) address is not a valid address according to RFC822 2) encoding of the personal is not supported

public java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String key)

Gets the value for a header with the specified key. If the value with the key does not exist, null is returned.

Parameters:
key - the key of header to get
Returns:
value for the key argument, null if the value does not exist
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if key is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is empty string after being trimmed.
Since:

getToAddress

public javax.mail.Address[] getToAddress(int type)

Returns a list of formatted "to" addresses of the specified type. If no addresses of the given type have been set, the returned array will be of length 0.

Parameters:
type - the address type (TO, CC, or BCC)
Returns:
a list of formatted addresses.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the address type is not defined

removeHeader

public java.lang.String removeHeader(java.lang.String key)

Removes this header with the specified key from the email entirely. If the specified header is not present, nothing happens.

Parameters:
key - the key of header to remove
Returns:
old value of header for key, or null if the header is not present
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key is null
Since:
3.0

Parameters:

setFromAddress

public void setFromAddress(java.lang.String addr)
                    throws AddressException

Sets the from address of this message. The address should be in RFC822 format, otherwise AddressException will be thrown.

Parameters:
addr - the "from" address in RFC822 format
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if addr is null
AddressException - if addr is not a valid address according to RFC822

setFromAddress

public void setFromAddress(java.lang.String addr,
                           java.lang.String personal)
                    throws AddressException

Sets the from address with a personal name.

Parameters:
addr - the new "from" address in RFC822 format
personal - the personal name
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if either argument is null
AddressException - if 1) address is not a valid address according to RFC822 2) encoding of the personal is not supported

setHeader

public void setHeader(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String value)

Sets a new header value. If an old value exists for the key, it is overwritten.

Parameters:
key - key for header to set.
value - value to set header to
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if either key or value is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is empty string after being trimmed.
Since:
3.0

setPriority

public void setPriority(PriorityLevel priority)

Sets the value for the priority variable. Also sets or resets the value of the various priority headers for the newly set priority.

It first clears the old headers for the priority, then add the new headers. To find the new headers for the given priority, it tries to search the configuration under the default namespace, it also tries to add the configuration file if the namespace does not present. If there is no configuration for the headers of the given priority or any error occurs when searching the configuration, the default headers of this priority are used instead.

Parameters:
priority - the new priority to set.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if priority is null
Since:
3.0

setSubject

public void setSubject(java.lang.String subject)

Sets the subject of the message.

Parameters:
subject - the new subject text

setToAddress

public void setToAddress(java.lang.String addr,
                         int type)
                  throws AddressException

Sets the address of the specified delivery type (TO, CC, or BCC). Any to addresses this type that have already been set will be discarded.

Parameters:
addr - the new address in RFC822 format
type - the type of the address (TO, CC, or BCC)
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if addr is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not TO, CC, nor BCC
AddressException - if address is not a valid address according to RFC822

setToAddress

public void setToAddress(java.lang.String addr,
                         java.lang.String personal,
                         int type)
                  throws AddressException

Sets the address of the specified type (TO, CC, or BCC). Any to addresses this type that have already been set will be discarded.

Parameters:
addr - the new address in RFC822 format
personal - the new personal name
type - the type of the address (TO, CC, or BCC)
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if either addr or personal is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not TO, CC, nor BCC
AddressException - if 1) address is not a valid address according to RFC822 2) encoding of the personal is not supported
